definition: to see in the New Year/to stay up all night on lunar New Year's Eve
to guard/to defend/to keep watch/to abide by the law/to observe (rules or ritual)/nearby/adjoining
variant of 歲|岁[sui4], year/years old
classifier for years (of age)/year/year (of crop harvests)

sentences.english: Reportedly, the Chinese people in a New Year's Eve see the old habits.
sentences.chinese: 据称，中国民间在除夕有守岁的习惯。

sentences.english: On New Year's Eve, many people stay up the whole night.
sentences.chinese: 在除夕之夜，很多人都是整晚不睡来守岁的。

sentences.english: Then they huddle around the kitchen hearth waiting for the first dawn of the bright New Year.
sentences.chinese: 他们在除夕也要大扫除，然后一家人围在炉边守岁。

sentences.english: On New Year's Eve, people always stay up late, which is called "Shousui".
sentences.chinese: 除夕夜里，人们通常都会熬夜，这被称为“守岁”。

sentences.english: (stay up) On New Year's Eve, many Chinese stay up till midnight to welcome the new year.
sentences.chinese: 在除夕夜，许多中国人守岁到半夜迎接新年的到来。

sentences.english: Do you stay up until midnight on New Years Eve?
sentences.chinese: 在除夕夜里，你会守岁吗？

sentences.english: New Year's Eve on the boil gradually formed the habit of years, Shou Sui.
sentences.chinese: 就逐渐形成了除夕熬年守岁的习惯。

definition: last day of the lunar year/Chinese New Year's Eve
lunar New Year's Eve
to set off firecrackers
last day of the lunar year/Chinese New Year's Eve
(of a family) to come together at lunar New Year's Eve/family reunion at New Year's
to set off firecrackers
to have a reunion
lunar New Year's Eve
New Year's Eve family dinner
New Year's Day in the lunar calendar
Lantern Festival/night of the 15th of the first lunar month/see also 元夜[yuan2 ye4]/sticky rice dumplings
Lantern Festival, the final event of the Spring Festival 春節|春节, on 15th of first month of the lunar calendar
to celebrate the Chinese New Year
to offer sacrifices to one's ancestors
usher out the old, greet the new/esp. to see in the New Year
to offer sacrifices to the kitchen god
